rComments: Yigal is really an amazing person and professor. It was a pleasure to attend his class 4 hours every week. Course load is not heavy at all - usually there's small homework assignments, a midterm and a final. He really does his best to engage his students and ensure they understand the material.
If you have a chance to be in his class, do it. If you participate, you will be pleased with your progress and your grades! You will not regret it!
Fantastic person, and an excellent professor. That's a rare combination. Very informative, engaged, enthusiastic, and helpful.

He is an INCREDIBLE teacher! Invested in his students, totally knowledgeable and incredibly helpful- he has made learning a new language approachable and exciting. I took mhb155 with him, am currently in mhb156, and will be continuing in hebrew with him next year. Trust me, this prof is actually wonderful!

Very difficult course. The majority of students were fluent and pretended they were not. Those coming from intermediate were overwhelmed and those coming new to the class were given supplementary material and were bored. If you are fluent I recommend this course, if not stay away or you will hate Hebrew after you finish this.
